data.title: Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX
data.meta_description: In 2022, Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX had a population of 132k people with a median age of 37.8 and a median household income of $93,194. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX grew from 129,069 to 131,938, a 2.22% increase and its median household income grew from $84,190 to $93,194, a 10.7% increase.
data.text:
As of 2022, 87.7% of Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX residents were US citizens, which is lower than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX was 88%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been decreasing.

In 2022, there were 2.28 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (56.3k people) in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX than any other race or ethnicity. There were 24.7k Asian (Non-Hispanic) and 16.4k Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

As of 2022, 25.5% of Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX residents (33.6k people) were born outside of the United States, which is higher than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX was 24.5%, meaning that the rate has been increasing.

33.3% of the households in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX reported speaking a non-English language at home as their primary shared language, which is higher than the national average of 21.7%. This does not consider the potential multi-lingual nature of households, but only the primary self-reported language spoken by all members of the household.

In 2022, the most common non-English language spoken in households in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX was Spanish. 15.5% of the households in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX reported speaking Spanish at home as the primary shared language between all members living in the household.

The most common job groups, by number of people living in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX, are Other managers (2,419 people), Software developers (2,223 people), and Retail salespersons (2,158 people). This chart illustrates the share breakdown of the primary jobs held by residents of Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX, are Restaurants & Food Services (4,001 people), Construction (3,856 people), and Computer Systems Design (3,782 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX, though some of these residents may live in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

As of February 2023, there are 13.8M people employed in Texas. This represents a 4.59% increase in employment when compared to February 2022.

Right after the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, during April 2020, a general dip can be seen across industry sectors, resulting in an overall decline in employment by 9.63%.

In the 2020 presidential election, the popular vote in Texas went to Donald J. Trump with 52.1% of the vote. The runner-up was Joseph R Biden Jr. (46.5%), followed by Jo Jorgensen (1.12%).

Members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms, and the following chart shows the how the members for Texas have changed over time starting in 2008.

The graph shows the evolution of awarded degrees by degrees. Under the paragraphs, the average number of awarded degrees by university in each degree is shown.

In 2022, 1.43% of men over 25 years of age had not completed any academic degree (no schooling), while 1.22% of women were in the same situation.

This visualization illustrates the percentage distribution of the population according to the highest educational level reached. You can filter the data by race by using the selector above.

The following chart display owner-occupied housing units distributed between a series of property tax buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. In Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX the largest share of households pay taxes in the $3k+ range.

In 2022, 50.1% of the housing units in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX were occupied by their owner. This percentage grew from the previous year's rate of 49.7%.

In 2022, the PUMA with the highest Median Household Income (Total) in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX was Fort Bend County (Northwest) PUMA, TX with a value of $159,431, followed by Denton County (South Central)--Flower Mound Town & Highland Village City PUMA, TX and Collin County (Northwest)--Celina City & Prosper Town PUMA, TX, with respective values of $157,973 and $153,785.

The following chart displays the households in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $200k+ range.

In 2022, the income inequality in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX was 0.445 according to the GINI calculation of the wage distribution. Income inequality had a 0.118% decline from 2021 to 2022, which means that wage distribution grew somewhat more even. The GINI for Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX was lower than than the national average of 0.478. In other words, wages are distributed more evenly in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX in comparison to the national average.

In 2022, 70.3% of workers in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX drove alone to work, followed by those who worked at home (19.9%) and those who carpooled to work (6.41%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX have a shorter commute time (25.2 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 0.684% of the workforce in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The following chart displays the households in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX distributed between a series of car ownership buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX have 2 cars.

7.7% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX (10.1k out of 132k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is lower than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Females 25 - 34, followed by Males 25 - 34 and then Females 35 - 44.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

In 2017, California had the highest estimated number of chronically homeless individuals in the nation, at 35,798. New York has the second highest (5,087), followed by Florida (4,915).

Primary care physicians in Texas see an average of 1,641 patients per year. This represents a 0.737% increase from the previous year (1,629 patients).

The following chart shows how the number of patients seen by primary care physicians has been changing over time in Texas in comparison to its neighboring geographies.

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 19.6% under 18 years, 25.4% between 18 and 34 years, 44% between 35 and 64 years, and 11% over 64 years.

Between 2021 and 2022, the percent of uninsured citizens in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX declined by 3.91% from 12.5% to 12%.

The following chart shows how the percent of uninsured individuals in Denton County (Far Southeast)--Carrollton (North) & Dallas (North) Cities PUMA, TX changed over time compared with the percent of individuals enrolled in various types of health insurance.
